THERE ARE LAKES AND RIVERS BELOW THE OCEAN SURFACE Some surfaces in the ocean present views that don\'t seem to make any logical sense – rivers and lakes, some of them kilometers long, can extend across the sea floor even though they are submerged. How can a body of water exist within a body of water? Seafloor water seeps in and dissolves salt layers, forming depressions. Since the water in the depression is denser than the water around it, it settles into the depression and forms a distinct pool.

How Can I Help?

Here are some ways to help the Blue Economy:

1. Reduce the use of disposable plastic.

2. Participate in coastal cleanup initiatives.

3. Support sustainable companies and products.

4. Educate yourself about the oceans and their importance to the planet.

5. Contribute to marine conservation organizations.

6. Practice sustainable fishing.

7. Raise awareness about the importance of oceans for life on Earth.

Project: All4Ocean\n\nAll4Ocean is an application developed to raise awareness and protect the oceans. Our goal is to educate people about the importance of the oceans and encourage actions to preserve the marine environment.

Blue Economy:\n\nThe Blue Economy refers to all economic activities related to the oceans and seas. It includes sectors such as fishing, tourism, maritime transport, oceanic renewable energy, among others.
